intro: Morelosia linearis, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. Morelosia linearis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and hardy nature.
